alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Oxford and south central Franklin Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 237 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mexico, or near Rumford, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Rumford, Jay, Dixfield, Canton, Wilton, Mexico, Weld, Chesterville, Hartford, Carthage, Avon, Perkins, Temple, Town Of Washington, Milton, Peru, Woodstock, Strong, and Vienna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western, south central and southwestern Maine.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford
